rawIndexableTextContent: A view that displays a sloth’s habitat.  Overview This sample code project doesn’t implement this view.
title: HabitatView
summary: A view that displays a sloth’s habitat.

rawIndexableTextContent: Create a sloth and assign personality traits and abilities. Overview Sloths are complex creatures that require careful creation and a suitable habitat. After creating a sloth, you’re responsible for feeding them, providing fulfilling activities, and giving them opportunities to exercise and rest. Every sloth has a name and color. You can optionally provide a power if your sloth has special supernatural abilities.  Create a Sloth To create a standard sloth without any special supernatural powers, you initialize a new instance of the Sloth structure, and supply a name and a color, as the following code shows:  If your sloth possesses one of the special powers of ice, fire, wind, or lightning, you can specify this at creation:  If you’re creating a large number of sloths, you can define your own random name generator that conforms to the NameGenerator protocol, and use it to generate names:  Provide a Habitat Sloths thrive in comfortable habitats. To create a sloth-friendly habitat, you specify whether it’s humid, warm, or both. The following listing creates a habitat that’s humid and warm, which results in a high comfortLevel:  After you create a sloth habitat, you’re ready for sloths to sleep in it. Sleeping in a habitat increases the energyLevel of the sloth by the comfort level of the habitat. Sloths sleep for long periods so, by default, your sloth sleeps for 12 hours, but you can also customize this value:  Exercise a Sloth To keep your sloths happy and fulfilled, you can create activities for them to perform. Define your activities by conforming to the Activity protocol and implementing the perform(with:) method:  Feed a Sloth Sloths require sustenance to perform activities, so you can feed them Sloth.Food. Standard sloth food includes leaves and twigs:  Schedule Care for a Sloth To make it easy to care for your sloth, SlothCreator provides a CareSchedule structure that lets you define activities or foods for your sloth to enjoy at specific times. Create the schedule, then provide a tuple of a Date and an Activity, or you can use some of the standard care procedures:
title: Getting Started with Sloths
summary: Create a sloth and assign personality traits and abilities.

rawIndexableTextContent: Creates a view that configures a sloth’s power.  A binding to the selected power.
title: init(power:)
summary: Creates a view that configures a sloth’s power.

rawIndexableTextContent: The care schedule of the sloth.  Discussion A care schedule maintains the health and happiness of the sloth.
title: schedule
summary: The care schedule of the sloth.

rawIndexableTextContent: Moves slightly faster than a snail.
title: Speed.slow
summary: Moves slightly faster than a snail.

rawIndexableTextContent: Food that a sloth can consume.  Overview Sloths love to eat the leaves and twigs they find in the rainforest canopy as they slowly move around. To feed them these items, you can use the twig, regularLeaf and largeLeaf default foods.  You can also define your own custom sloth food by providing a name and the energy level. When the sloth eats your custom food, their energy level increases by the energy of the food:
title: Sloth.Food
summary: Food that a sloth can consume.

rawIndexableTextContent: Create, catalog, and care for sloths using SlothCreator. Get started with SlothCreator by building the demo app Slothy.
title: Meet SlothCreator
summary: Create, catalog, and care for sloths using SlothCreator. Get started with SlothCreator by building the demo app Slothy.

rawIndexableTextContent: A meal that a sloth usually eats at the end of the day, in the evening.
title: CareSchedule.Event.dinner
summary: A meal that a sloth usually eats at the end of the day, in the evening.

rawIndexableTextContent: The habitat where sloths live.  Overview Sloths love hanging out in rain forests, and are especially grateful for hot and humid habitats. They spend much of their time asleep, so make sure the habitats you create provide comfortable and reliable branches in a large number of trees for them to feel safe and protected. The warmth and humidity of the habitat affect how much a sloth’s energyLevel increases when they sleep:
title: Habitat

rawIndexableTextContent: A model representing a sloth.  Overview Sloths are mammals known for their slowness of movement. They spend most of their lives hanging upside down in trees. You can create a sloth using the init(name:color:power:) initializer, or create a randomly generated sloth using a SlothGenerator:
title: Sloth

rawIndexableTextContent: Creates food with the specified name and energy level.  The name of the food. The amount of energy the food contains.
title: init(name:energy:)
summary: Creates food with the specified name and energy level.

rawIndexableTextContent: The energy level of the sloth.  Discussion Sloths have a very low metabolic rate, so their energy level is often low as well. It’s important to check their energy level often, and offer them food or opportunities to sleep before asking them to perform an activity or exercise. You can increase the sloth’s energy level by asking them to eat(_:quantity:) or sleep(in:for:).
title: energyLevel
summary: The energy level of the sloth.

rawIndexableTextContent: The actions a sloth performs at scheduled times.
title: events
summary: The actions a sloth performs at scheduled times.

rawIndexableTextContent: Eat the provided specialty sloth food.  Return Value The sloth’s energy level after eating. The food for the sloth to eat. The quantity of the food for the sloth to eat. Discussion Sloths love to eat while they move very slowly through their rainforest habitats. They are especially happy to consume leaves and twigs, which they digest over long periods of time, mostly while they sleep. When they eat food, a sloth’s energyLevel increases by the food’s energy. You can feed a sloth any custom Sloth.Food that you define yourself, or you can feed them one of the standard foods of twig, largeLeaf, or regularLeaf:  By default, the sloth eats one of the food items you provide, but you can also specify how many of the items the sloth should eat if you have an abundance to share with them:
title: eat(_:quantity:)
summary: Eat the provided specialty sloth food.

rawIndexableTextContent: The wind power.  Discussion Wind sloths thrive at soaring altitudes. Their claws have the power of summoning wind, propelling their furry bodies through the air in a motion similar to flying. The high speed of the wind causes the sloths’ fur to be in perpetual disarray.
title: Sloth.Power.wind

rawIndexableTextContent: A type that declares an activity a Sloth can perform.
title: Activity
summary: A type that declares an activity a Sloth can perform.

rawIndexableTextContent: No special power.  Discussion Standard sloths are still extraordinary creatures. Their claws have the power of holding onto tree branches, rocky outcrops, and outstretched arms. They might be slow, but they are still magnificent.
title: Sloth.Power.none

title: PowerPicker
summary: A view to configure a sloth’s power.

summary: A meal that a sloth usually eats around the middle of the day, in the early afternoon.

title: NameGenerator

title: comfortLevel

rawIndexableTextContent: Sleep in the specified habitat for a number of hours.  Return Value The sloth’s energy level after sleeping. The location for the sloth to sleep. The number of hours for the sloth to sleep. Discussion Sloths need to sleep for a large number of hours each day because of their low metabolic rate. Each time the sloth sleeps, their energyLevel increases every hour by the habitat’s comfortLevel. By default, the sloth sleeps for 12 hours:  You can also specify a custom number of hours:
title: sleep(in:for:)
summary: Sleep in the specified habitat for a number of hours.

rawIndexableTextContent: This tutorial guides you through building Slothy — an app for creating and caring for custom sloths. You’ll start by building the sloth creation view. Create and configure an Xcode project that uses SlothCreator. Create a new project using the iOS App template. Enter “Slothy” as the Product Name. Select “SwiftUI” from the Interface pop-up menu and “SwiftUI App” from the Life Cycle pop-up menu, then click Next. Choose a location to save the Slothy project on your Mac. Add SlothCreator as a dependency to the project. Add the ability for users to customize sloths and select their powers. Create a new SwiftUI View file named CustomizedSlothView.swift. Import the SlothCreator package. Create a Sloth state variable called sloth. Delete the template Text view, then add a new VStack with trailing padding. This adds space around and between any views inside. Add a SlothView. Specify the sloth state variable for the view’s sloth binding. Add a PowerPicker. Specify the sloth‘s power for the picker view’s power binding. The following steps display your customized sloth view in the SwiftUI preview. Add the sloth parameter to initialize the CustomizedSlothView in the preview provider, and pass a new Sloth instance for the value. Set the preview provider sloth’s name to "Super Sloth", color to .blue, and power to .ice.
title: Creating Custom Sloths
summary: This tutorial guides you through building Slothy — an app for creating and caring for custom sloths. You’ll start by building the sloth creation view.

rawIndexableTextContent: Create and configure an Xcode project that uses SlothCreator. Create a new project using the iOS App template. Enter “Slothy” as the Product Name. Select “SwiftUI” from the Interface pop-up menu and “SwiftUI App” from the Life Cycle pop-up menu, then click Next. Choose a location to save the Slothy project on your Mac. Add SlothCreator as a dependency to the project.
title: Create a new project and add SlothCreator
summary: Create and configure an Xcode project that uses SlothCreator.

rawIndexableTextContent: Add the ability for users to customize sloths and select their powers. Create a new SwiftUI View file named CustomizedSlothView.swift. Import the SlothCreator package. Create a Sloth state variable called sloth. Delete the template Text view, then add a new VStack with trailing padding. This adds space around and between any views inside. Add a SlothView. Specify the sloth state variable for the view’s sloth binding. Add a PowerPicker. Specify the sloth‘s power for the picker view’s power binding. The following steps display your customized sloth view in the SwiftUI preview. Add the sloth parameter to initialize the CustomizedSlothView in the preview provider, and pass a new Sloth instance for the value. Set the preview provider sloth’s name to "Super Sloth", color to .blue, and power to .ice.
title: Add a customization view
summary: Add the ability for users to customize sloths and select their powers.

rawIndexableTextContent: The lightning power.  Discussion Lightning sloths thrive in stormy climates. Their claws have the power of summoning lightning. Beware of shaking a lightning sloth’s hand without rubber shoes.
title: Sloth.Power.lightning

rawIndexableTextContent: Generates a piece of food in the specified habitat.
title: generateFood(in:)
summary: Generates a piece of food in the specified habitat.

rawIndexableTextContent: Catalog sloths you find in nature and create new adorable virtual sloths. Overview SlothCreator provides models and utilities for creating, tracking, and caring for sloths. The framework provides structures to model an individual Sloth, and identify them by key characteristics, including their name and special supernatural power. You can create your own custom sloths using a SlothGenerator, and name them using a NameGenerator. Sloths need careful feeding and maintenance to ensure their health and happiness. You maintain their energyLevel by providing the correct Sloth.Food and a suitable Habitat. You can exercise your sloth by providing a fun or restful Activity. You can visualize and observe your sloths by adding a SlothView to a SwiftUI view structure.
title: SlothCreator
summary: Catalog sloths you find in nature and create new adorable virtual sloths.

rawIndexableTextContent: The fire power.  Discussion Fire sloths thrive at boiling temperatures. Their claws have the power of summoning fire. A fire sloth is happiest while taking a lava bath.
title: Sloth.Power.fire

rawIndexableTextContent: An action a sloth can perform.
title: CareSchedule.Event
summary: An action a sloth can perform.

rawIndexableTextContent: The ice power.  Discussion Ice sloths thrive below freezing temperatures. Their claws have the power of summoning snow and ice. Despite their usual slowness, their metabolism has the ability of speeding up for snowball fights.
title: Sloth.Power.ice

rawIndexableTextContent: A meal that a sloth usually eats at the start of their day, in the morning.
title: CareSchedule.Event.breakfast
summary: A meal that a sloth usually eats at the start of their day, in the morning.
